zone.line: curious feeling of unreality attached by him
to his foreign life in comparison with
that the years had passed of ye his
youth. All the time ^he had passed away out
of England was as a dream, and all the
interest of his soul all his affections
belonged to events which had happened
and persons who had existed sixteen
years before. It was strange when
you heard him talk to see how he
passed over this lapse of time as a
night of visions; while the remembrances
of his youth standing seperate as they
did from his after life had lost none
of their ^vigour vividness. He talked of my
Mother as if she had lived but a
few weeks before; not that he ex-
pressed poignant grief, but his discrip
tion of her person, and his relation
of all anecdotes connected with her was
thus fervent and vivid.
